abstract: Google may have pushed the boundaries of the law in its Waze deal, but the question is whether the government pushes back.
snippet: Google may have pushed the boundaries of the law in its Waze deal, but the question is whether the government pushes back.
lead_paragraph: Google’s motto is “don’t be evil.” But its recent acquisition of Waze, reportedly for $1 billion in cash, shows that just because you’re not evil, it doesn’t mean you can’t be aggressive in pushing the boundaries of the law.

headline.main: Google’s Effort to Skirt Regulation May Invite More Scrutiny
headline.print_headline: Google’s Effort to Skirt Regulation May Invite More Scrutiny
